header.title: The Scroll of Set - November 1978, Issue Number 39, Volume IV-3

central_thesis: This issue emphasizes the Setian path of self-evolution (Xeper) through rigorous critical self-analysis, the integration of ancient principles (neters/Maat) into one's being, and the cultivation of a distinct 'Daimonhood' by consciously engaging with the Dark Prince Set, thereby fostering a unique Setian perspective distinct from conventional human thought.

structure_content.summary: This article defines objective (visual observation) and subjective (reading/hearing) analysis, stressing the necessity for 'Setian Analysis.' This approach involves questioning all information, even from reputable sources, to overcome human biases and frailties, particularly in discerning authentic Setian magic from subconscious occult projections. It advocates for critical thought as a core Setian discipline.

This piece explores the ancient Egyptian concept of 'neter' as a parallel to modern 'nature,' connecting it to Maat (truth/justice) and the Setian 'Xeper-process.' It proposes that integrating these ancient, ageless principles into one's 'Core Self' is essential for Setian evolution, forming an unbroken link to an ancient past and defining future goals for the evolving Magician.

This article describes Black Magic within a Setian framework, where the Dark Prince Set's will and direction, often perceived as alien, are understood by the 'Elect' through the 'Black Flame.' It emphasizes that a magician, having sent their will to the elements of Darkness, must be prepared to act and change in accordance with the resulting manifestations, irrespective of whether they are painful or joyous.

A short reflection where the author expresses finding her own unspoken thoughts articulated by other Setians in the Scroll. This highlights a perceived collective consciousness or shared ideological resonance among Setian practitioners, particularly concerning self-knowledge and the understanding of Maat.

structure_content.chapter_title: Pylon Formed in Los Angeles Area
structure_content.summary: This report details the establishment of a new Setian Pylon named Set-Amentet in Los Angeles. It describes the informal gathering that initiated its formation, subsequent meetings focused on mutual Xeper, and a ritual visitation by Magus Michael A. Aquino, illustrating the communal and organizational aspects of Setian practice.

This article elucidates 'Daimonhood' as a state achieved when a Setian magician advances from White to Black Magic, integrating a 'dimensional disposition' (a 'new self') with their 'human self.' This 'new child of the Black Flame' represents a profound realization of Set's distinct intelligence, conferring divine attributes upon the individual and signifying a unique form of self-deification.

This is a recommendation for a forthcoming book from National Geographic, 'Ancient Egypt: Discovering Its Splendors.' It suggests that the book would be of interest to Setians due to the deep, inexplicable resonance many feel with ancient Egyptian civilization, particularly its pyramids, temples, and tombs.

key_concepts.definition: A rigorous critical thinking process for Setians, requiring skepticism towards all information (spoken, written, visual), questioning purported facts, and analyzing from a unique Setian viewpoint to discern truth from human bias or subconscious projection in magical and occult contexts.

The Egyptian principle of Truth and Justice, symbolizing a 'True and Just state of being.' For Setians, it personifies the distinction between humanity's predictable nature ('them 'n' us') and the Setian path, serving as a framework for understanding one's evolving self.

An ancient Egyptian concept of cosmic causal functions or principal functions, which the text parallels with the modern concept of 'nature.' Setians are encouraged to 're-create and re-recognize' these ageless principles within themselves as part of the Xeper-process.

Defined as evolvement, growth, and specifically, for Setians, the 're-creating and re-recognizing' of ancient 'neters' within oneself. It signifies the continuous process of developing one's magical essence, establishing an unbroken link to the past, and defining future goals.

A metaphorical internal faculty or 'special 'glasses'' possessed by the 'Elect' (Setians) that allows for perception of dimensional depth, understanding the intended plan of the Dark Prince Set, and guiding action, enabling the integration of dæmonic and human aspects.

A state of being for a Setian magician who has progressed from White to Black Magic, characterized by the successful merger of their 'human self' with a 'dimensional disposition' or 'new self.' This results in a 'Daimon/man' who embodies the attributes of a Daimon – a divine quality stemming from a profound realization of Set's unique intelligence.

The central deity/intelligence in Setianism, described as an 'Intelligence/Majesty' whose will and love guide Setians, often through methods and manifestations that are 'alien' to human understanding, necessitating the 'Elect' to discern its direction.

practical_system.description: The practical system articulated herein is one of rigorous self-development and intellectual discipline, aimed at achieving individual apotheosis. It involves constant self-analysis ('Setian Analysis') to transcend human frailties and biases, the active process of 'Xeper' to integrate ancient archetypal principles ('neters') into one's personal being, and the cultivation of 'Daimonhood' by consciously engaging with the Dark Prince Set. This engagement, often guided by an inner 'Black Flame,' is meant to facilitate a merger of the mundane and 'dimensional' self, leading to a unique form of self-divinity.
tools: Black Flame (internal faculty for perception of Set's will)
Will (as a force to be mastered)
Pylon (local organizational structure for mutual Xeper)
rituals: Collective ritual practice (e.g., Pylon meetings, visitation by Magus Aquino)
Direct magical operation by 'sending forth will to the elements of Darkness'

relevant_quotes.text: We cannot take anything that is spoken, written or published - even by so-called reputable sources - as the complete, factual truth. Question everything, analyze it from a Setian viewpoint - even when involved in magic or occult.
Make objective and subjective analysis a rule in all cases, but be sure it is Setian Analysis.
Maat, the principal of Truth, her feather symbolic of a True and Just state of being, personifies for me that oft-mentioned phrase, 'them 'n' us'.

What I am presenting is actually another interpretation of the Xeper-process, but perhaps with a somewhat different slant. We have heard Xeper defined as evolvement, growth toward ... but I am offering other words such as 're-creating and re-recognizing' those ancient and ageless principles called neters by the Egyptians; re-recognizing them in and as our selves, thereby creating that which is both our unbroken [though sometimes time-shrouded] link with an ancient past, and an undeniable goal as well.

The Dark Prince Set knows what is deeply meaningful to each of us if we allow him to know us. But once a magician asks favor of the Prince, he must realize the Dark Lord is an Intelligence/Majesty and uses methods and devices, such as unsuspecting homo sapiens, beyond our scope of understanding. It is only the Elect within us that enables us to see the correct plan and direction of action.

Daimonhood is a quality within a magician that is neither in or of itself. It is a gift worthy of those who have opened the gates to themselves and who carry within them a profound realization of the existence of Set as an intelligence and essence distinct from that of any 'known' quality of human existence.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles is foundational for understanding the philosophical underpinnings and practical approach of the Temple of Set in the late 1970s. It outlines core concepts like Setian Analysis, Xeper, and Daimonhood, which remain central to Setian practice. It distinguishes Setianism from broader occultism by emphasizing a unique, individualistic, and deeply analytical path to self-deification, contrasting it sharply with conventional human perceptions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily active and prospective members of the Temple of Set. It serves as an internal educational and philosophical guide, reinforcing core tenets and encouraging specific modes of thought and practice. It would also be of interest to academic researchers studying the development of modern Left Hand Path traditions and the specific tenets of Setian philosophy.
